alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 2:18PM EDT until June 16 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central and western Maine, including the following counties, in west central Maine, Somerset. In western Maine, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 216 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding and flooding of low-lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kingfield, Phillips, Anson, Freeman, New Portland, New Vineyard, Strong, Salem, Lexington and Industry.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
